attributes.title: Mixing chart yields vs expected yields
attributes.description:
+ Manual mixing chart/summaries yields were analyzed and compared with those expected (SAP) for accuracy for the period ranging 01.03.25 - 20.03.25.

+ Yields were matching as shown on the table below;
attributes.recommendation: + Matching of yields is commendable as it ensures accountability for bread produced.

value: + Yield compliance was in place.
+ We always ensure that set yields are recorded on respective documents.
+ Bread yield records were matching for the period analyzed 01.02.25 - 18.02.25.
Previous
+ Mixing charts/summaries records were analyzed and compared to SAP (BOM set yields) to check accuracy of posting.
+ Yields were matching and this ensures bread yield accountability.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring set standard yields are recorded on production registers and accurately transferred on SAP system.

attributes.title: Physical stock verification
attributes.description:
The table below shows the summary of the stock findings

·           The following were the stock findings;

ü  Bread -     -66.75 loaves.

ü  Cumulative variance in polybags was -173pieces.

ü  All other materials had negligible variances.
attributes.recommendation: ·           The management to ensure that the set stock controls are consistently adhered to avoid stock variances.

value: ·           More improvement measures will be initiated.
+ Control is ok and will maintain the trend.
+ Physical stock verified on 19/02/2025 showed minimal item variation.
Previous

+    A stock take exercise was conducted on 21.03.25 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place to safeguard company assets such as the production materials and the finished products.
+ Minimal variances noted in stock items is an indication that stock controls are being observed.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring strong internal controls at the branch to check item loss.

attributes.title: Dough weight analysis
attributes.description:
+ The below table shows analysis of dough weights sampled on 23/03/2025.

Dough weights sampled on 21.03.2025:(1  shift @12.30pm)

+Dough weighed showed high overweight rate,
attributes.recommendation: + Set dough dividing weights should be adhered to inorder to ensure standard bread weight production.
attributes.effect: Overweight dough means reduced yields hence revenue loss.

value: + Noted high overweight dough will be addressed.
+ We will sensitize dough dividers on the importance of adhering to set dough dividing weights.
+ Dough weighed on 20.02.25 showed adherence to set dough dividing weights.
Current
+ Dough weights were randomly sampled during spot checks to asses compliance to set weights.
+ Overweight dough was noted and this lowers yield targets hence withholding revenue targets.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring compliance to set dough dividing weights.

attributes.title: Bread weight analysis
attributes.description:
+ Bread was weighed on 21.03.25;

+ Samples weighed showed over and underweight bread above the acceptable 10%.

+ High overweight bread was noted for 600g white bread while 800g white bread showed high underweight bread rate.
attributes.recommendation:
+ Noted high under and overweight bread should be addressed.

+ Dough dividing should be done adhering to set dividing ranges.
attributes.effect: + Overweight bread deprives the company revenues while underweight bread will pose regulatory risk.

value: + Noted bread weights both over and underweights will be closely monitored and addressed.
+ Will put more focus on dough weights adherence and closely monitor cooling time
+ Packed bread weighed on 20/02/25 showed high under and overweight bread rate.
Previous
+ Sample varieties of packed bread were randomly picked and weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.

+ High over and underweight bread noted.

·         Under and overweight bread presence suggests inconsistency during dough dividing.

·         Presence of underweight bread exposes the company to risks of fines and penalties from regulatory bodies.

+ High overweight bread on the other end deprives the company revenues because this lowers expected yields.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensure production of standard weight bread.

attributes.title: Bread damage analysis.
attributes.description:
+ Analysis showed high production damage rate (exceeded acceptable 0.2% of total loaves produced).

PRODUCTION DAMAGE ANALYSIS:

·          Production damage rate is tabulated below.

MARKET DAMAGE ANALYSIS:

·          Market damage rate is tabulated below.
attributes.recommendation:
+ Proper baking processes will ensure that damages are fully checked.

+ The management should focus on efforts to address high bread damages to ensure that the company doesn’t lose revenues
attributes.effect: + High bread damages increased production costs.

value: + We will put more efforts to address noted high bread damages.

+ Most of the damages are a result of oven damages due to faulty elements,

+ Will ensure production procedures are strictly followed as this will ensure consistency in quality and at the end minimal damages both from market and production.
+ February 2025 audit report highlighted high production and market damage rate as analyzed from 01/02/25 – 18/02/2025.
Previous

·          The test was conducted to determine the extent of damages produced during production and those replaced as market damages and find out if they were within expected/set limits. High damages suggest bread of inferior quality produced.
+ High production and market damages implies that the company is exposed to losses and revenue targets were not realized. Lost revenue during this period was at least Kshs. 33,337.00.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring control of bread damages (production and market)

attributes.title: Raw material consumption
attributes.description:
+ Analysis was done for raw materials consumed from 01.03.25 - 20.03.25.

+ Raw materials were consumed as per set standards.
attributes.recommendation: + Observed adherence to set standard raw material consumption quantities is commendable.
attributes.effect:
+ Raw materials and finished product was accounted for.

+ Production costs were also checked.

value: + Raw materials were consumed as per set standard.
+ Set standard raw material consumption was adhered to.
+ February 2025 audit report showed that raw materials were consumed as per set standards as analyzed from 01.02.25 - 18.02.2025.
Previous
+ This exercise was conducted to determine if set consumption standards for raw materials were adhered to as per company policy.
+ Raw materials were consumed as per expected and this checks production costs.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring raw materials are consumed/used as per set standard consumption quantities.

01/03/25 – 20.03.2025

Correct posting was also noted over the audited period.
attributes.recommendation: + The branch should continue observing the set consumption and production standards.
attributes.effect: + Raw materials were properly accounted for.

value: + This is noted and will be maintained.

+ Mixing charts records were accurate as analyzed from 01.02.25 - 18.02.25.
Previous
+ Comparison of manual mixing charts and the system mixing charts was done from 01.02.25 – 20.03.25 to find out if accurate transfer of production data was being done.
+ Proper documentation was noted and this ensures accountability.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring accuracy mixing charts records and accurate data transfer.

attributes.title: Mini shop spot checks (Loading and sales verification)
attributes.description:
·          Mini shop spot check was conducted on 21.03.2025.

·         The shop attendant accounted for all the bread loaded.

·         All sales were made through Mpesa till.

·         The below table shows details of mini shop transactions.
attributes.recommendation: + The Mini shop attendant should keep up with the observed good stock and cash control.
attributes.effect: + Proper accountability of bread transferred to the mini shop means low risk of bread loss.

value: + Accountability and controls noted at the mini shop will always be ensured.
+ Controls on mini shop to be maintained.
+ Mini shop spot check on 19.02.25 showed proper controls and bread accountability.
Previous
·          A spot check was conducted in the mini shop to assess whether their operations were being carried out in accordance with the established standards.
+ Mini shop SOPs are followed.
Sales Department
+ Ensuring accountability of all bread loaded at the mini shop and that bread sales are in cash terms.

attributes.title: Production efficiency analysis.
attributes.description:
·          Analysis was done from 01/02/2025 - 20/03/2025. Production efficiency is tabulated below;

                   + Production inefficiency was noted.
attributes.recommendation:
·          Branch management should ensure proper production planning to address noted production inefficiency.

+      Costs incurred from operational inefficiencies should be recovered through surcharge.
attributes.effect: + Production costs were increased due to surplus wage payment.

value: + Production inefficiency resulted from shift cuts.
+ Shift cuts were the major reason for production inefficiency noted.
+ February 2025 audit report highlighted operational inefficiencies as analyzed from 01/02/25 – 18/02/25.
Previous
·          This test was conducted to determine if set production  efficiency was adhered to. Low efficiency would indicate increased production costs.
+ Production inefficiency noted increased production costs.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring adherence to set production efficiency standards.

+ Costs incurred from operational inefficiencies should be recovered through surcharge.
attributes.effect: + There was increased production costs due to surplus wage payments.

value: + We will put necessary measures to improve on noted operational inefficiencies.

Previous
·          This test was conducted to determine if set  packing efficiency was adhered to. Low efficiency would indicate increased production costs.

Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring adherence to set packing efficiency standards.

attributes.title: Debtors analysis
attributes.description: · Outstanding debts for customers as at 22.03.25 was Kshs.191,766.00 while for institutions was Kshs.1,195,998.50.
attributes.recommendation: + Sales team must ensure credit limits for institutions are set and follow up.
attributes.effect: + Customer debts expose the company to losses through bad debts.

value:
+ Credit limit is set for institutions.

+ We don’t supply customers with outstanding debts in that the SAP system is locked such that it doesn’t allow invoicing for such customers.

·         Will follow up with the sales rep and the TSM, at the moment all customers with balances aren’t supplied until the debt is cleared.

·         However, most of this balances are with customers with security deposits equal or more compared to the debt.
+ February 2025 audit report highlighted customer outstanding balances as analyzed on debtors analysis as at 20.02.25.
Previous
+ Analysis of the branch outstanding balances as at 22nd March 2025 for routes and institutions was done to determine the debtors’ value and if the company is exposed to bad debts.
+ High route balances without equal security deposit poses a great risk to the company of bad debts.
Finance Department
+ Ensuring no customer outstanding balances for routes, mini shops and institutions and if there is, security deposit that serves as collateral is provided.
